newsitem.title: COLOMBIA: 3 killed in north Colombia, British priest escapes.
newsitem.headline: 3 killed in north Colombia, British priest escapes.

text.p: Unidentified gunmen dragged three men from their homes and shot them to death in a northern Colombia fishing village early on Tuesday, local authorities said.

Catholic Church workers who asked not to be identified, said the gang may have been looking for British priest John Mahoney, who works in the village of Barranca Nueva and was reported to have escaped a mob of attackers on Monday.

The dead, two fishermen and a businessman, were found with multiple gunshot wounds on the outskirts of the village on the banks of the Magdalena River in Bolivar province, mayor Pedro Guerrero told Reuters.
"We don't know if it was the guerrillas or paramilitaries," Guerrero said. "All we can say is it looks like one of the groups who have taken up arms."
